questions.question_text: In Snowflake, what allows users to perform recursive queries?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
In Snowflake, a managed access schema allows the schema owner (or a designated role) to have full control over granting privileges on objects within the schema. In this configuration, only the schema owner can grant or revoke privileges on the objects within the schema, preventing other users from doing so.

questions.question_text:
A user wants to create objects within a schema but wants to restrict other usersâ€™ ability to grant privileges on these objects.

What configuration should be used to create the schema?
What is the MOST cost-effective way to resolve memory spillage in a virtual warehouse?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D - others explanation are good

Selected Answer: D
A Snowpark-optimized warehouse is designed to efficiently handle workloads with more complex memory usage patterns, like data processing and machine learning, by providing optimized resource allocation, which can help mitigate memory spillage without significantly increasing costs.

B. Enable the query acceleration service.
The query acceleration service dynamically adds additional compute resources (more CPU and memory) to a virtual warehouse when queries require more resources than initially allocated. This can be a cost-effective solution as it only scales up resources temporarily during peak demand, potentially reducing memory spillage without the need to permanently increase the warehouse size.

Selected Answer: D
"When a query requires additional memory without additional compute, it is more cost effective to switch to a Snowpark-optimized warehouse rather than increasing the size of the warehouse."

comments.content: When a query requires additional memory without additional compute, it is more cost effective to switch to a Snowpark-optimized warehouse rather than increasing the size of the warehouse

discussion.content: AC - Data masking is supported on views and tables

Selected Answer: AC
"Snowflake supports using Dynamic Data Masking on tables and views."

Selected Answer: AC
Dynamic Data Masking is a Column-level Security feature that uses masking policies to selectively mask plain-text data in table and view columns at query time.

questions.question_text: What objects in Snowflake are supported by Dynamic Data Masking? (Choose two.)

A user has created a dashboard in Snowflake and wants to share it with colleagues.

How can the dashboard be shared?

choices.B: By using the share option within Snowsight
choices.A: By creating a private Data Exchange
choices.D: By creating a listing on Snowflake Marketplace
choices.C: By using a Direct Share with another account

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Agree with B
